sense.name: insert or close with a plug
sense.examples: I plugged the video-out port on my video card into the receiver. I plugged the iKaraoke into my iPod and nothing happened. When it ceased the operations oil corporation plugged the wells. What would be the result if the breathing pores were plugged up?

sense.name: work persistently at something
sense.examples: The beginning was awful but I plugged away at the book hoping that it redeem itself in the end. I plugged away into the maelstrom and gradually drew closer to the Island. I plugged away at the game whenever I could squeeze an hour away from my job.

sense.name: praise the qualities in order to sell or promote
sense.examples: We never plugged the events on our website. I plugged the movie 'your punishment.'

sense.name: hit or shoot at
sense.examples: Tinman plugged the German's plane full of holes. He was probably lucky she hadn't plugged him full of buckshot. I plugged him in the back of the head and claimed my bounty.

sense.name: connect electronic devices to one another or a power source
sense.commentary:
Includes: PLUG IN
NOTE: This sense is a subsense of sense 1 that is specific to electronic devices.
sense.examples: I plugged the video-out port on my video card into the receiver. I plugged the iKaraoke into my iPod and nothing happened. Please plug in the light.
